body.p: In May 2010, the FASB published a proposed Accounting Standards Update Accounting for Financial Instruments and Revisions to the Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities (the ‘2010 proposed Update’) that included proposals for impairment as part of its comprehensive approach to replacing the accounting requirements for financial instruments in US Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP). The FASB’s objective for credit impairment was to develop a single model for all financial instruments that provides more timely credit loss information for users of financial statements.
